Title.evidence: Title: Randomised Controlled Trial of Surgical Techniques for Choledocholithiasis

Participants.evidence: 50 patients diagnosed with CBD stones. Participants were selected based on specific eligibility criteria

Intervention.evidence: underwent different interventions: ERCP followed by laparoscopic cholecystectomy, laparoscopic CBD exploration, or open CBD exploration

Objective.evidence: This study evaluates the postoperative outcomes of open common bile duct (CBD) exploration, laparoscopic CBD exploration, and a combined endoscopic and surgical approach.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was stone clearance, assessed intraoperatively and postoperatively over a 12-month follow-up.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation and blinding were not applicable.

Blinding.evidence: Randomisation and blinding were not applicable.

Result_Outcome.evidence: Stone clearance rates were similar across methods, with a stricture and stone recurrence rate of 2.94%.

Harms.evidence: Postoperative complications included pulmonary issues (22%) and wound infections (20%).
